a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x P Q R :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = 2 * x powr 2 + 3 * x + 3"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = x powr 2 + 6 * x - 6"
and h2 : "\<forall> x. R x = (P x - Q x) * (x + 3)"
shows  "R x = x powr 3 + 27"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Expand $((2x^2+3x+3)-(x^2+6x-6))(x+3)$. The final Answer is x^3+27
 ### Proof
 We have that \begin{align} &((2x^2+3x+3)-(x^2+6x-6))(x+3)\\ &\qquad= (x^2-3x+9)(x+3) \\ &\qquad= x(x^2-3x+9) + 3(x^2-3x+9) \\ &\qquad= x^3 -3x^2 +9x +3x^2 -9x +27 \\ &\qquad= \boxed{x^3+27}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes x P Q R :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = 2 * x powr 2 + 3 * x + 3"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = x powr 2 + 6 * x - 6"
and h2 : "\<forall> x. R x = (P x - Q x) * (x + 3)"
shows  "R x = x powr 3 + 27"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Given functions $P(x) = 2x^2 + 3x + 3$, $Q(x) = x^2 + 6x - 6$, find the function $R(x)$ such that $R(x) = (P(x) - Q(x)) \cdot (x + 3)$. The final answer is $R(x) = x^3 + 27$.

a_1.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q R :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = (2 * x powr 2 + 3 * x + 3) - (x powr 2 + 6 * x - 6)"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = x + 3"
and h2 : "\<forall> x. R x = P x * Q x"
shows  "R x = x powr 3 + 27"
a_1.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Expand $((2x^2+3x+3)-(x^2+6x-6))(x+3)$. The final Answer is x^3+27
 ### Proof
 We have that \begin{align} &((2x^2+3x+3)-(x^2+6x-6))(x+3)\\ &\qquad= (x^2-3x+9)(x+3) \\ &\qquad= x(x^2-3x+9) + 3(x^2-3x+9) \\ &\qquad= x^3 -3x^2 +9x +3x^2 -9x +27 \\ &\qquad= \boxed{x^3+27}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q R :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = (2 * x powr 2 + 3 * x + 3) - (x powr 2 + 6 * x - 6)"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = x + 3"
and h2 : "\<forall> x. R x = P x * Q x"
shows  "R x = x powr 3 + 27"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_1.informal problem: Find the product of the functions $P(x) = (2x^2 + 3x + 3) - (x^2 + 6x - 6)$ and $Q(x) = x + 3$. What is the final expression for the function $R(x) = P(x) * Q(x)$? The final answer is $R(x) = x^3 + 27$.

assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = (2 * x powr 2 + 3 * x + 3) - (x powr 2 + 6 * x - 6)"

a_3.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x P Q R :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = 2 * x powr 2 + 3 * x + 3"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = x powr 2 + 6 * x - 6"
and h2 : "\<forall> x. R x = x + 3"
and h3 : "\<forall> x. P x - Q x = R x * (x powr 2 - 1)"
shows  "\<forall> x. (P x - Q x) * R x = x powr 3 + 27"
a_3.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Expand $((2x^2+3x+3)-(x^2+6x-6))(x+3)$. The final Answer is x^3+27
 ### Proof
 We have that \begin{align} &((2x^2+3x+3)-(x^2+6x-6))(x+3)\\ &\qquad= (x^2-3x+9)(x+3) \\ &\qquad= x(x^2-3x+9) + 3(x^2-3x+9) \\ &\qquad= x^3 -3x^2 +9x +3x^2 -9x +27 \\ &\qquad= \boxed{x^3+27}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes x P Q R :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = 2 * x powr 2 + 3 * x + 3"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = x powr 2 + 6 * x - 6"
and h2 : "\<forall> x. R x = x + 3"
and h3 : "\<forall> x. P x - Q x = R x * (x powr 2 - 1)"
shows  "\<forall> x. (P x - Q x) * R x = x powr 3 + 27"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_3.informal problem: Let $P(x) = 2x^2 + 3x + 3$, $Q(x) = x^2 + 6x - 6$, and $R(x) = x + 3$. If $P(x) - Q(x) = R(x)(x^2 - 1)$ for all $x$, find an expression for $(P(x) - Q(x))R(x)$. The final answer is $x^3 + 27$.
